name: moby/moby
description: Moby is an open framework created by Docker to assemble specialized container systems without reinventing the wheel. It provides a “lego set” of dozens of standard components and a framework for assembling them into custom platforms.

name: portainer/portainer
description: Portainer is a lightweight management UI which allows you to easily manage your different Docker environments (Docker hosts or Swarm clusters). Portainer is meant to be as simple to deploy as it is to use.

name: goharbor/harbor
description: Harbor is an open source container image registry that secures images with role-based access control

name: containerd/containerd
description: containerd is an industry-standard container runtime with an emphasis on simplicity
column6: robustness and portability. It is available as a daemon for Linux and Windows
column7: which can manage the complete container lifecycle of its host system.

name: docker/docker-ce
description: Docker Engine is the industry’s de facto container runtime that runs on various Linux (CentOS
column11: and Ubuntu) and Windows Server operating systems.
